description: very useful,and install easy

It is a bit tricky to install matlab, but the app is working properly. You have to download a compressed file from Mathworks, decompress it, and than give the folder's path to this app. This will only install it, if you have the right path and folder name.

Adds an icon for Matlab and (if you select the option) renames bundled Matlab libraries to avoid conflict. Simple to set up. If it doesn't work for you, remember this is just a helper app, not Matlab. You need to install Matlab first from the Mathworks website before installing this helper app.
Adds icon and you can run it from Activities

Tad bit tricky to get MATLAB working on linux but this makes it much easier. Gotta follow Mathworks' installation instructions and install MATLAB properly, then install this. Point it to the correct directory and bam, good working installation of MATLAB.
summary: Good for getting MATLAB to work

description: I was wondering how to create a proper icon shortcut for Matlab and this tool made that for me.

I tried to put Matlab on Debian 10.1. Now, whenever I try to update my system it gets stuck at Matlab location. I uninstalled it, still a problem. Searched the forums, people advise "find out where you installed it, and point it there." If I knew where it installed it would not be a problem. The point is, if you are going to install Matlab, read about how to install and what directory it goes to first. It could break your system as it broke mine.

To change from older version (e.g. 2020b) to newer version (e.g. 2021a), go to /etc/matlab/ and edit the debconf file. Edit the line with MATLAB_INSTALL_GLOB by inserting the new version (if MATLAB is installed to default folder, e.g. MATLAB_INSTALL_GLOB="/usr/local/MATLAB/R2021a")
summary: Lacking version change instructions but works

Saludos, tal vez a muchos le ocurriò la pesadilla, de que el programa MATLAB, no se terminò de descargar, o simplemete no se instalò bien.
Y ocurre el tremendo problema de que ya no puedes instalar mas programas porque te salen errores por el MATLAB, mal instalado, y peor aún, ya nisiquera podemos hacer un sudo apt update en paz, yo intenté eliminar el directorio de MATLAB manualmente y ni siquiera existe, de hecho intenté hacer de todo, y nada fincionaba.
a continuación les dejo el comando me funcionó (Para por lo menos poder volver a instalar programas y hacer update y upgrades en paz) 

sudo apt-get remove matlab-support

el comando anterior,me solucionó el problema del Matlab mal instalado.
Espero le sea util a alguien mas, tanto como me fue a mí.
Saludos
